content.webTitle: Frentzen's sister plays grand theft auto

fields.headline: Frentzen's sister plays grand theft auto
fields.bodyText: The Schumachers, Ralf and Michael, were not the only sporting siblings behind the wheel during last Sunday's French grand prix. While Heinz-Harald Frentzen was guiding his Sauber around the circuit at Magny-Cours, his 14-year-old sister Nicole-Nadine was taking their mother's Mercedes for an unauthorised spin around the streets of Mönchengladbach. Nicole-Nadine was detained by police after she was caught driving the car with her 11-year-old sister Samantha and a 12-year-old friend as passengers, a spokesman for police in the western German city said. Her parents were watching the grand prix on television at the time. "We got a call from a driver who saw the under-aged girl driving and a police car was dispatched to investigate," the spokesman said yesterday. "She was stopped and faces charges of driving without a licence. Thank God nothing happened." Her father, Heinrich-Harald, said although he was angry at his teenaged daughter he could understand why she did it. "She has petrol in her blood," he said. "She already takes part in kart-racing and regularly beats the boys. When she has her driving licence maybe she will try out for formula BMW. That would be the next step towards formula one." Nicole-Nadine, however, faces a four-year wait before she can obtain a driving licence. Heinrich-Harald Frentzen said sibling rivalry was not new in formula one but brother-sister duels were. "We have already seen sufficient clashes between brothers - but brother against sister, that would be something." Although the younger generation of Frentzens clearly share a penchant for high-speed driving their father is used to travelling at a slower pace. He is a funeral director.
